testCases.query: Commit my authentication changes with a proper message
expectedBehavior: Uses conventional commit format: type(scope): description
Includes Co-Authored-By trailer
Subject line under 72 characters
References issue number with # prefix

testCases.query: I changed the API and updated the docs, commit everything
expectedBehavior: Verifies each commit does ONE logical thing
Ensures codebase remains working after commit
Commit message does not need 'and' in title
Each commit can be reverted independently

testCases.query: I have changes to the database schema and the UI, how should I commit?
expectedBehavior: Recommends splitting into separate commits
Suggests using git add -p for interactive staging
Separates unrelated changes into distinct commits
Reviews staged vs unstaged changes with git diff

testCases.query: Fix a typo in the error message
expectedBehavior: Uses quick commit pattern for trivial changes
Uses fix type prefix
Includes Co-Authored-By trailer
Does not spawn agents for simple changes
Checks current branch before committing
Refuses to commit to main or dev branches
Suggests creating a feature branch first
Uses issue/<number>-<description> naming convention
